headline: Immigration Texas Sheriff Investigating Marthas Vineyard Migrant Flights
summary: On Monday, a Texas sheriff said that he waslaunching an investigationinto Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis sending 48 Venezuelan migrants from Texas to Florida to Martha's Vineyard last week.Bexar County Sheriff Javier Salazar, a Democrat, has claimed that the migrants were "lured" to board flights from Bexar County with false promises of a better life when in reality, they were "used as political pawns." Governor DeSantis has meanwhile stated that theflight to Martha's Vinyeard on September 14thwas part of Florida's program torelocate migrants to sanctuary cities, which he said was for thewell-being of migrants; he citedat least 46 migrants who were found deadin a tractor-trailer in Bexar County in late June.Sheriff Salazar's team is working with attorneys representing some of the migrants to establishwhich state and federal laws may have been brokenandwho should be charged. Salazar also says that he believes a Venezuelan migrant was paid a "bird dog fee" to recruit the migrants from a resource center in San Antonio, which is located in Bexar County.News of the launching of the investigation waswidely covered by news sources across the political spectrum.
